Motley Fool Stock Advisor presents5 Stocks Under $49We hear it over and over from investors, “I wish I had bought Amazon or Netflix when they were first recommended by the Motley Fool.
If you had invested in Amazon when we sent a “buy alert” at $15.31 per share, you’d be up 11,596%.
John Mackey, CEO of Whole Foods Market, an Amazon subsidiary, is a member of The Motley Fool’s board of directors.
The Motley Fool owns shares of Amazon and Netflix.
The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.
paragraphs: We hear it over and over from investors, “I wish I had bought Amazon or Netflix when they were first recommended by the Motley Fool. I’d be sitting on a gold mine!” And it’s true.
If you had invested in Amazon when we sent a “buy alert” at $15.31 per share, you’d be up 11,596%.
Or if you had invested in Netflix when we recommended it at $1.85 per share, you’d be up 16,914%.
And while Amazon and Netflix have had a good run, we think these 5 other stocks are screaming buys. And you can buy them now for less than $49 a share!
You can grab a copy of “5 Growth Stocks Under $49” for FREE for a limited time only.
Don’t look back five years from now, regretting that you failed to act. Simply enter your email below and we’ll send your five free stock picks directly to your inbox.

Returns are updated during market hours. John Mackey, CEO of Whole Foods Market, an Amazon subsidiary, is a member of The Motley Fool’s board of directors. David Gardner owns shares of Amazon and Netflix. Tom Gardner owns shares of Netflix. The Motley Fool owns shares of Amazon and Netflix. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.
title: The Motley Fool
